      • ifAllExplicitlySet

        public static Defaultable<Boolean> ifAllExplicitlySet(Defaultable<?>... items)
        Create a Boolean configuration that has a default value of true if all arguments have been explicitly set to non-default values.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to test.
        Returns:
        The new item.

      • ifAnyExplicitlySet

        public static Defaultable<Boolean> ifAnyExplicitlySet(Defaultable<?>... items)
        Create a Boolean configuration that has a default value of true if any arguments have been explicitly set to non-default values.
        Parameters:
        items - The items to test.
        Returns:
        The new item.

                throws NoSuchElementException

      • get

        public T get()
      throws NoSuchElementException
        Retrieve the value, regardless of it's origin.
        Specified by:
        get in interface Supplier<T>
        Returns:
        The value, if non-null.
        Throws:
        NoSuchElementException - If no value (default nor explicit) is present.

      • explicit

        public Optional<T> explicit()
        Retrieve a standard Optional containing the explicit value, if any.

        If no explicit value is set, an empty Optional will be returned.

        Returns:
        The Optional wrapper around the explicitly set value, if any.

      • ifPresent

        public void ifPresent(Consumer<? super T> consumer)
        If a default or explicit value is present, invoke the supplied consumer with it.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer.

      • ifExplicit

        public void ifExplicit(Consumer<? super T> consumer)
        If (and only if) an explicit value is present, invoke the supplied consumer with it
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer.

      • ifDefault

        public void ifDefault(Consumer<? super T> consumer)
        If (and only if) only a default value is present (without an explicit value), invoke the supplied consumer with it.
        Parameters:
        consumer - The consumer.

      • orElse

        public T orElse(T defaultValue)
        Retrieve the value (default or explicit) if present, otherwise the provided value parameter.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - The value to return only if no value is present.
        Returns:
        Either the value (default or explicit) or the defaultValue parameter.

      • orElseGet

        public T orElseGet(Supplier<? extends T> other)
        Retrieve the value (default or explicit) if present, otherwise return the value supplied by the Supplier parameter.
        Parameters:
        other - The value supplier to use to supply a value only if no value is present.
        Returns:
        Either the value (default or explicit) or the value supplied by the other Supplier parameter.

      • explicitOrElseGet

        public T explicitOrElseGet(Supplier<? extends T> other)
        Retrieve the explicit value if present, otherwise return the value supplied by the Supplier parameter.
        Parameters:
        other - The value supplier to use to supply a value only if no explicit value is present.
        Returns:
        Either the explicitly set value (if set) or the value supplied by the other Supplier parameter.

      • get

        public T get(Supplier<? extends T> preferred)
        Retrieve the explicit value if present, followed in precedence by whatever value, if not-null supplied by the preferred parameter, followed by the default if all previous options were null.
        Parameters:
        preferred - The intermediate value supplier.
        Returns:
        The explicitly set, preferred or default value in that order, or possibly null.

      • isPresent

        public boolean isPresent()
        Determine if any value (default or explicit) is present.
        Returns:
        true is a value is present, otherwise false.

      • isExplicitPresent

        public boolean isExplicitPresent(Supplier<T> other)
        Determine if either an explicit value is set of the supplied other Supplier parameter returns non-null.
        Parameters:
        other - The alternative value supplier.
        Returns:
        true if either an explicit value is set or the supplier provides a non-null value.

      • isDefault

        public boolean isDefault()
        Determine if the value that would be provided (even if null) is the default value or not.
        Returns:
        true only if no explicit value is set.

      • isExplicit

        public boolean isExplicit()
        Determine if the value that would be provided is explicitly set or not.
        Returns:
        true only if an explicit value is set.
